graph_title: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
indicator_name: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
indicador_disponible: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
objetivo_global: 14- Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
meta_global: 14.5 By 2020, conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information
definicion: Percentage of important sites for marine biodiversity (those that contribute significantly to the global persistence of biodiversity) that are covered by protected areas
formula:
$$PKBA_{mar}^{t} = \frac{APKBA_{mar}^{t}}{KBA_{mar}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$APKBA_{mar}^{t} =$ area of ​​important sites for marine biodiversity covered by protected areas in year $t$

$KBA_{mar} =$ surface area of ​​important sites for marine biodiversity in year $t$
justificacion_global:
The safeguard of important sites is vital for stemming the decline in biodiversity and ensuring long term 
and sustainable use of marine natural resources. The establishment of protected areas is an important 
mechanism for achieving this aim, and this indicator serves as a means of measuring progress toward the 
conservation, restoration and sustainable use of marine ecosystems and their services, in line with 
obligations under international agreements. 

This indicator adds meaningful information to, complements and builds from traditionally reported 
simple statistics of marine area covered by protected areas, computed by dividing the total protected 
area within a country by the total territorial area of the country and multiplying by 100 (e.g., Chape et al. 
2005). Such percentage area coverage statistics do not recognise the extreme variation of biodiversity 
importance over space (Rodrigues et al. 2004), and so risk generating perverse outcomes through the 
protection of areas which are large at the expense of those which require protection. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
dato_global: Average proportion of Marine Key Biodiversity Areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas (%) ER_MRN_MPA UNSTATS
comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with the United Nations metadata

es.indicador_disponible: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
es.objetivo_global: 14- Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
es.meta_global: 14.5 By 2020, conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information
es.definicion: Porcentaje de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad marina (aquellos que contribuyen significativamente a la persistencia global de la biodiversidad) que está cubierto por áreas protegidas
es.formula:
$$PKBA_{mar}^{t} = \frac{APKBA_{mar}^{t}}{KBA_{mar}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$APKBA_{mar}^{t} =$ superficie de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad marina cubierta por áreas protegidas en el año $t$

$KBA_{mar} =$ superficie de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad marina en el año $t$
es.justificacion_global:
La protección de lugares importantes es vital para frenar la pérdida de biodiversidad 
y garantizar el uso sostenible a largo plazo de los recursos naturales marinos. 
El establecimiento de áreas protegidas es un mecanismo clave para lograr este objetivo, 
y este indicador sirve para medir el progreso hacia la conservación, la restauración y 
el uso sostenible de los ecosistemas marinos y sus servicios, de conformidad con las 
obligaciones contraídas en virtud de los acuerdos internacionales.

Este indicador aporta información significativa, complementa y amplía las 
estadísticas simples tradicionalmente reportadas sobre el área marina cubierta 
por áreas protegidas. Se calcula dividiendo el área protegida total de un país 
entre su superficie territorial total y multiplicando por 100 (p. ej., Chape et al., 2005). 
Estas estadísticas de cobertura porcentual no reconocen la extrema variación de la importancia 
de la biodiversidad en el espacio (Rodrigues et al., 2004), por lo que corren el riesgo de 
generar resultados perversos al proteger áreas extensas en detrimento de las que requieren protección.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
